subject: Leadership
title: Tuckman's Stages of Team Development
description: Learn Tuckman's Stages of Team Development in one minute.

hook.text: A new project team starts enthusiastic. By week three, arguments erupt. By month two, they're unstoppable.

buildup.text: Tuckman identified four stages: forming, storming, norming, and performing. Every team moves through this arc.

discovery.text: Storming isn't failureâ€”it's necessary. Teams that skip conflict never build the trust needed for high performance.

twist.text: Many teams stall in storming because leaders treat conflict as a problem to fix rather than a phase to navigate.

climax.text: Great leaders recognize which stage their team is in and adjust: directive early, coaching mid, delegating late.

punchline.text: Storms build strong teams. Avoiding them builds fragile ones.

quiz.question: What is the correct order of Tuckman's stages?
